de.uni.leipzig.asv.zitationsgraph.extraction

Class ReferenceExtraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni.leipzig.asv.zitationsgraph.extraction.ReferenceExtraction

  • public class ReferenceExtraction
extends java.lang.Object
    This class find the references with the authors, title and year in a reference Part string of scientific Paper. The main method is the referenceMining (String referenceString), which receive a reference part as string. The result is a list of Citation
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    loco

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Vector<Citation> getCitationVector() 
      java.lang.String getCurrentText() 
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void printNames() 
      void referenceMining(java.lang.String referenceString)
      main method
      setup
      create empty Collections and fill the authorMatcherList and citationMatcherList with CustomMatcher instances, which include the manual created Patterns
      first step
      tokenize lines, save the position of each line and try to find a prefix
      second step
      test the patterns for references and author names and sort according to the matchCount the lists, which include the patterns
      third step
      optional divide the refernce string in single references, if a prefix is recognized
      fourth step
      find names
      fifth step
      tokenize references based on author name occurrence or on author name occurrence and reference style
      sixth step
      remove names witch match the author pattern, but occur behind the author part
      seventh step
      find the title in each reference and the year
      void setCitationVector(java.util.Vector<Citation> citationVector) 
      void setCurrentText(java.lang.String currentText) 
      void testPos()
      test print methode to check the right position for lines
      void testPrintCitations()

    • Method Detail

      • referenceMining

        public void referenceMining(java.lang.String referenceString)
        main method
        setup
        create empty Collections and fill the authorMatcherList and citationMatcherList with CustomMatcher instances, which include the manual created Patterns
        first step
        tokenize lines, save the position of each line and try to find a prefix
        second step
        test the patterns for references and author names and sort according to the matchCount the lists, which include the patterns
        third step
        optional divide the refernce string in single references, if a prefix is recognized
        fourth step
        find names
        fifth step
        tokenize references based on author name occurrence or on author name occurrence and reference style
        sixth step
        remove names witch match the author pattern, but occur behind the author part
        seventh step
        find the title in each reference and the year
        Parameters:
        referenceString - the reference part of a scientific paper
